title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**D(\clq_\theta)**: The goal of this paper is to determine finite Blaschke products $\theta$ and analytic self-maps $\vp \in \cls(\D)$ such that
\[C_\vp \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta,\]That is, the finite-dimensional model spaces $\clq_\theta$ that are invariant under the composition operator $C_\vp$. More specifically, our aim is to study the following object:
\[D(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi \in \cls(\D): C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta\right\}.\]

**H^2**: where $H^2$ denotes the Hardy space on $\D$. It is a classical result that $C_\varphi$ is a bounded linear operator on $H^2$ for all $\varphi\in \mathcal{S}(\mathbb{D})$ \cite{Shapiro}. Given an analytic self-map $\vp: \D \raro \D$ (in short, $\vp \in \cls(\D)$), the \textit{composition operator} $C_\vp$ is defined on $H^2$ by\[C_\vp f = f \circ \vp \qquad (f \in H^2).\]

**L(\clq_\theta)**: This perspective suggests another object similar to $D(\clq_\theta)$, defined as follows:
\[
L(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi: \mathbb{C}_\infty \to \mathbb{C}_\infty
\text{ analytic},  \varphi \not \equiv \infty, \text{ and } C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta \right\}
\]
Observe that rational functions are precisely the functions holomorphic at $\infty$; hence, every element of $L(\clq_\theta)$ is necessarily a rational function (also see \cite[Section 1]{Jav}).

**\T**: \def\T{\mathbb{T}}

**\clq_\theta**: The \textit{model space} (or, \textit{finite-dimensional model space} to be more specific) associated with \theta is defined as \[ \clq_{\theta} = H^2 \ominus \theta H^2, \] where $H^2$ denotes the Hardy space on \D. It is known that \[ \text{dim} \clq_\theta = n. \]

**\mathbb{C}**: \mathbb{C} represents the space of all constant functions on \D.

**\theta**: Given \(\lambda_1, \ldots, \lambda_n \in \D\), we define the \textit{finite Blaschke product}\[\theta = \prod_{j=1}^{n} b_{\lambda_j}.\]

---

\label{remark11}
Let $\theta = \alpha z$ for some $\alpha \in \T$. Then
\[
\clq_\theta = H^2 \ominus  z H^2 = \mathbb{C},
\]
where $\mathbb{C}$ represents the space of all constant functions on $\D$. In this case, it is trivial to note that
\[
L(\clq_\theta)= \{\text{all the rational functions}\},
\]
and
\[
D(\clq_\theta)= \mathcal{S}(\mathbb{D}),
\]
and consequently, $L(\clq_\theta)$ and $D(\clq_\theta)$ are not comparable semigroups.

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**$D(\clq_\theta)$**: The goal of this paper is to determine finite Blaschke products $\theta$ and analytic self-maps $\vp \in \cls(\D)$ such that
\[C_\vp \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta,\]That is, the finite-dimensional model spaces $\clq_\theta$ that are invariant under the composition operator $C_\vp$. More specifically, our aim is to study the following object:
\[D(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi \in \cls(\D): C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta\right\}.\]

**$L(\clq_\theta)$**: This perspective suggests another object similar to $D(\clq_\theta)$, defined as follows:
\[
L(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi: \mathbb{C}_\infty \to \mathbb{C}_\infty
\text{ analytic},  \varphi \not \equiv \infty, \text{ and } C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta \right\}
\]
Observe that rational functions are precisely the functions holomorphic at $\infty$; hence, every element of $L(\clq_\theta)$ is necessarily a rational function (also see \cite[Section 1]{Jav}).

---

\label{prop: D sub L}
Let $\theta$ be a finite Blaschke product that is not a rotation. Then
\[
D(\clq_\theta) \subseteq L(\clq_\theta).
\]

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**\D**: \def\D{\mathbb{D}}

**\cls(\D)**: Given an analytic self-map $\vp: \D \raro \D$ (in short, $\vp \in \cls(\D)$), the \textit{composition operator} $C_\vp$ is defined on $H^2$ by
\[
C_\vp f = f \circ \vp \qquad (f \in H^2).
\]
It is a classical result that $C_\varphi$ is a bounded linear operator on $H^2$ for all $\varphi\in \mathcal{S}(\mathbb{D})$ \cite{Shapiro}. The goal of this paper is to determine finite Blaschke products $\theta$ and analytic self-maps $\vp \in \cls(\D)$ such that
\[
C_\vp \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta,
\]

**\mathbb{C}**: \mathbb{C} represents the space of all constant functions on \D.

**\varphi**: Let \varphi : \D \raro \mathbb{C} be an analytic function.

---

\label{lem1}
Let $\varphi : \D \raro \mathbb{C}$ be an analytic function. Suppose
\begin{equation*}
\frac{1}{1-p\varphi(z)}=\frac{a}{1-qz} \qquad (z \in \D),
\end{equation*}
for some  complex numbers $0<|p|\leq |q|<1$ and $a\neq 0$. Then the following conditions are equivalent:
\begin{enumerate}
\item $\varphi \in \cls(\D)$.
\item $a=1$ and $|p|=|q|$.
\item $\varphi$ is a rotation.

\end{enumerate}
In either of these cases, we have $\varphi(z)=\frac{q}{p} z$.

Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**D(\clq_\theta)**: The goal of this paper is to determine finite Blaschke products $\theta$ and analytic self-maps $\vp \in \cls(\D)$ such that
\[C_\vp \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta,\]That is, the finite-dimensional model spaces $\clq_\theta$ that are invariant under the composition operator $C_\vp$. More specifically, our aim is to study the following object:
\[D(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi \in \cls(\D): C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta\right\}.\]

**L(\clq_\theta)**: This perspective suggests another object similar to $D(\clq_\theta)$, defined as follows:
\[
L(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi: \mathbb{C}_\infty \to \mathbb{C}_\infty
\text{ analytic},  \varphi \not \equiv \infty, \text{ and } C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta \right\}
\]
Observe that rational functions are precisely the functions holomorphic at $\infty$; hence, every element of $L(\clq_\theta)$ is necessarily a rational function (also see \cite[Section 1]{Jav}).

**\theta**: Given \(\lambda_1, \ldots, \lambda_n \in \D\), we define the \textit{finite Blaschke product}\[\theta = \prod_{j=1}^{n} b_{\lambda_j}.\]

**b_{\lambda}^n**: We begin by considering the case where $\theta$ is a finite Blaschke product with a single zero of arbitrary multiplicity: \[ \theta = b_{\lambda}^n, \] for some $\lambda \in \mathbb{D} \setminus \{0\}$ and $n \in \mathbb{N}$. Let $\theta = b_{\lambda}^n$ for some $\lambda \in \mathbb{D} \setminus \{0\}$ and $n \in \mathbb{N}$. 

---

Let $\theta = b_{\lambda}^n$ for some $\lambda \in \mathbb{D} \setminus \{0\}$ and $n \in \mathbb{N}$. Then $D(\clq_\theta)$ is a trivial group, whereas
$L(\clq_\theta)$ is a noncyclic infinite group.

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
\label{lem: Javad}
Let $\theta$ be a finite Blaschke product that does not vanish at the origin. Assume that $\#\clz(\theta) \geq 2$. Then $\varphi \in\ L(Q_\theta)$ if and only if
there exist constants $a (\neq 0)$ and $b$ such that
\[
\varphi(z)=az+b,
\] with
\[
\text{mult}_\theta (\lambda) = \text{mult}_{\theta}\left(\frac{\overline{a} \lambda}{1-
\overline{b} \lambda}\right),
\]
for all $\lambda \in \clz(\theta)$.

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**L(\clq_\theta)**: This perspective suggests another object similar to $D(\clq_\theta)$, defined as follows:
\[
L(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi: \mathbb{C}_\infty \to \mathbb{C}_\infty
\text{ analytic},  \varphi \not \equiv \infty, \text{ and } C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta \right\}
\]
Observe that rational functions are precisely the functions holomorphic at $\infty$; hence, every element of $L(\clq_\theta)$ is necessarily a rational function (also see \cite[Section 1]{Jav}).

**\varphi^{[n]}**: \varphi^{[n]}=z.

---

[]\label{affine}
Let $\theta$ be a finite Blaschke product. Assume that $\theta(0)\neq 0$ and $\# \clz(\theta) \geq 2$. Then there exist $a, b \in \mathbb{C}$ and $n \in \mathbb{N}$ such that
\[
L(\clq_\theta)= \left\{ z, \varphi, \varphi^{[2]}, \dots, \varphi^{[n-1]} \right\}
\]
where
\[
\varphi(z)=az+b,
\]
and
\[
\varphi^{[n]}=z.
\]
In particular, $L(\clq_\theta)$ is a finite cyclic subgroup of $\mathrm{Aut}(\mathbb{C})$.

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**D(\clq_\theta)**: The goal of this paper is to determine finite Blaschke products $\theta$ and analytic self-maps $\vp \in \cls(\D)$ such that
\[C_\vp \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta,\]That is, the finite-dimensional model spaces $\clq_\theta$ that are invariant under the composition operator $C_\vp$. More specifically, our aim is to study the following object:
\[D(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi \in \cls(\D): C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta\right\}.\]

**\T**: \def\T{\mathbb{T}}

**\varphi(z)=\alpha z**: Let $\theta$ be a finite Blaschke product. Assume that $\theta(0)\neq 0$. Then $\varphi \in D(\clq_\theta)$ if and only if $\varphi(z)=\alpha z$ for some $\alpha \in \T$ with $$mult_\theta (\lambda) = mult_{\theta}(\bar{\alpha} \lambda)$$ for all $\lambda \in \clz(\theta)$. 

---

\label{thm1}
Let $\theta$ be a finite Blaschke product. Assume that $\theta(0)\neq 0$. Then $\varphi \in D(\clq_\theta)$ if and only if $\varphi(z)=\alpha z$ for some
  $\alpha \in \T$ with
  $$mult_\theta (\lambda) = mult_{\theta}(\bar{\alpha} \lambda)
  $$ for all $\lambda \in \clz(\theta)$.

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**D(\clq_\theta)**: The goal of this paper is to determine finite Blaschke products $\theta$ and analytic self-maps $\vp \in \cls(\D)$ such that
\[C_\vp \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta,\]That is, the finite-dimensional model spaces $\clq_\theta$ that are invariant under the composition operator $C_\vp$. More specifically, our aim is to study the following object:
\[D(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi \in \cls(\D): C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta\right\}.\]

**J_n**: For each $n \in \mathbb{N}$, in what follows, we write \[ J_n = \{1, \ldots, n\}, \] and denote by $S_n$ the symmetric group of degree $n$. 

**S_n**: We also denote by $S_n$ the symmetric group on $n$ letters.

---

\label{thm2}
Let $\{\lambda_1, \ldots, \lambda_n\} \subseteq \mathbb{D} \setminus \{0\}$ be a set of distinct elements and let $m_i \in \mathbb{N}$, $i=1, \ldots, n$. Let $\theta = \prod\limits_{i=1}^n b_{\lambda_i}^{m_i}$. Then $\varphi\in D(\clq_\theta)$ if and only if $\varphi=\omega z$, where
\[
\bar{\omega}=\frac{\lambda_{\sigma(1)}}{\lambda_1}=\frac{\lambda_{\sigma(2)}}{\lambda_2}=\dots=\frac{\lambda_{\sigma(n)}}{\lambda_n},
\]
for some $\sigma \in S_n$ with $m_i=m_{\sigma(i)}$ for all $i \in J_n$.

abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.

abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**$D(\clq_\theta)$**: The goal of this paper is to determine finite Blaschke products $\theta$ and analytic self-maps $\vp \in \cls(\D)$ such that
\[C_\vp \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta,\]That is, the finite-dimensional model spaces $\clq_\theta$ that are invariant under the composition operator $C_\vp$. More specifically, our aim is to study the following object:
\[D(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi \in \cls(\D): C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta\right\}.\]

**$n := \# \clz(\theta)$**: $n := \# \clz(\theta)$.

---

\label{thm3}
Let $\theta$ be a finite Blaschke product with $\theta(0)\neq 0$. If $n := \# \clz(\theta)$, then $D(\clq_\theta)$ is a cyclic subgroup of $\langle e^{\frac{2\pi i}{n}}z \rangle$.

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**$D(\clq_\theta)$**: The goal of this paper is to determine finite Blaschke products $\theta$ and analytic self-maps $\vp \in \cls(\D)$ such that
\[C_\vp \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta,\]That is, the finite-dimensional model spaces $\clq_\theta$ that are invariant under the composition operator $C_\vp$. More specifically, our aim is to study the following object:
\[D(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi \in \cls(\D): C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta\right\}.\]

---

Suppose $\theta$ is a finite Blaschke product with four distinct zeros and $\theta(0)\neq 0$. Then there are exactly three possible cyclic groups for $D(\clq_\theta)$:
\[
\{z\}, \langle -z\rangle =\{z, -z\}, \text{ and } \langle iz\rangle= \{z, -z, iz, -iz\}.
\]

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**D(\clq_\theta)**: The goal of this paper is to determine finite Blaschke products $\theta$ and analytic self-maps $\vp \in \cls(\D)$ such that
\[C_\vp \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta,\]That is, the finite-dimensional model spaces $\clq_\theta$ that are invariant under the composition operator $C_\vp$. More specifically, our aim is to study the following object:
\[D(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi \in \cls(\D): C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta\right\}.\]

**\Lambda_n**: Given a set of $n$ distinct points $\{\lambda_1, \ldots, \lambda_n\} \subseteq \mathbb{D} \setminus \{0\}$, we define \[ \Lambda_n = \left\{\dfrac{\lambda_1}{\lambda_1}, \dfrac{\lambda_2}{\lambda_1}, \dots, \dfrac{\lambda_n}{\lambda_1}\right\}. \]

---

\label{thm4}
Let $\{\lambda_1,\ldots, \lambda_n\}$ be a set of $n$ distinct points in $\mathbb{D} \setminus \{0\}$ and let $m_i \in \mathbb{N}$, $i=1, \ldots, n$. Define
\[
\theta = \prod_{i=1}^{n} b_{\lambda_i}^{m_i}.
\]
Then
\[
D(\clq_\theta) = \langle e^{\frac{2\pi i}{n}}z\rangle,
\]
if and only if $\Lambda_n$ is a multiplicative group, and
\[
m_1=m_2=\dots=m_n.
\]

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**D(\clq_\theta)**: The goal of this paper is to determine finite Blaschke products $\theta$ and analytic self-maps $\vp \in \cls(\D)$ such that
\[C_\vp \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta,\]That is, the finite-dimensional model spaces $\clq_\theta$ that are invariant under the composition operator $C_\vp$. More specifically, our aim is to study the following object:
\[D(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi \in \cls(\D): C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta\right\}.\]

**prime factorization**: n = p_1^{k_1} p_2^{k_2}...p_m^{k_m}, be the prime factorization of n.

---

Let $\theta$ be a finite Blaschke product and let $d$ be a divisor of $n:= \# \clz(\theta)$. Suppose $\theta(0)\neq 0$ and let
\[
n = p_1^{k_1} p_2^{k_2}...p_m^{k_m},
\]
be the prime factorization of $n$. Then
\[
D(\clq_\theta)=\langle e^{\frac{2\pi i}{d}}z\rangle,
\]
if and only if
\[
mult_\theta (\lambda)= mult_{\theta}(e^{\frac{2\pi i}{d}} \lambda),
\]
for all $\lambda \in \clz(\theta)$, and for each $j \in \{1, \ldots, m\}$, there exist $\lambda_j \in \clz(\theta)$ such that
\[
mult_\theta (\lambda_j)\neq mult_{\theta}(e^{\frac{2\pi i}{dp_j}} \lambda_j).
\]

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**D(\clq_\theta)**: The goal of this paper is to determine finite Blaschke products $\theta$ and analytic self-maps $\vp \in \cls(\D)$ such that
\[C_\vp \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta,\]That is, the finite-dimensional model spaces $\clq_\theta$ that are invariant under the composition operator $C_\vp$. More specifically, our aim is to study the following object:
\[D(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi \in \cls(\D): C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta\right\}.\]

**\Lambda_n**: Given a set of $n$ distinct points $\{\lambda_1, \ldots, \lambda_n\} \subseteq \mathbb{D} \setminus \{0\}$, we define \[ \Lambda_n = \left\{\dfrac{\lambda_1}{\lambda_1}, \dfrac{\lambda_2}{\lambda_1}, \dots, \dfrac{\lambda_n}{\lambda_1}\right\}. \]

**\theta**: Given \(\lambda_1, \ldots, \lambda_n \in \D\), we define the \textit{finite Blaschke product}\[\theta = \prod_{j=1}^{n} b_{\lambda_j}.\]

---

\label{thm5}
Let $n$ be a prime number, $\{\lambda_1, \ldots, \lambda_n\} \subseteq \mathbb{D} \setminus \{0\}$ be a set of $n$ distinct scalars, and let $\{m_i\}_{i=1}^n \subseteq \mathbb{N}$. Define
\[
\theta = \prod_{i=1}^{n} b_{\lambda_i}^{m_i}.
\]
Then $D(\clq_\theta) = \{z\}$ if and only if either not all the $m_i$'s are equal or $\Lambda_n$ is not a group.

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**D(\clq_\theta)**: The goal of this paper is to determine finite Blaschke products $\theta$ and analytic self-maps $\vp \in \cls(\D)$ such that
\[C_\vp \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta,\]That is, the finite-dimensional model spaces $\clq_\theta$ that are invariant under the composition operator $C_\vp$. More specifically, our aim is to study the following object:
\[D(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi \in \cls(\D): C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta\right\}.\]

---

\label{thm6}
Let $\theta$ be a finite Blaschke product. Assume that $\theta(0)\neq 0$ and $\# \clz(\theta) = p^k$ for some prime $p$ and $k \in \mathbb{N}$. Then $D(\clq_\theta)=\{z\}$ if and only if there exists $\lambda \in \clz(\theta)$ such that
\[
mult_\theta (\lambda)\neq mult_{\theta}(e^{\frac{2\pi i}{p}} \lambda).
\]

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**D(\clq_\theta)**: The goal of this paper is to determine finite Blaschke products $\theta$ and analytic self-maps $\vp \in \cls(\D)$ such that
\[C_\vp \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta,\]That is, the finite-dimensional model spaces $\clq_\theta$ that are invariant under the composition operator $C_\vp$. More specifically, our aim is to study the following object:
\[D(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi \in \cls(\D): C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta\right\}.\]

**prime factorization**: n = p_1^{k_1} p_2^{k_2}...p_m^{k_m}, be the prime factorization of n.

---

\label{thm7}
Let $\theta$ be a finite Blaschke product. Assume that $\theta(0)\neq 0$. Consider the prime factorization of $n := \# \clz(\theta)$ as
\[
n=p_1^{k_1} \cdots p_m^{k_m}.
\]
Then $D(\clq_\theta)=\{z\}$ if and only if for each $j \in \{1, \ldots, m\}$, there exists $\lambda_j \in \clz(\theta)$ such that
\[
mult_\theta (\lambda_j)\neq mult_{\theta}(e^{\frac{2\pi i}{p_j}} \lambda_j).
\]

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**D(\clq_\theta)**: The goal of this paper is to determine finite Blaschke products $\theta$ and analytic self-maps $\vp \in \cls(\D)$ such that
\[C_\vp \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta,\]That is, the finite-dimensional model spaces $\clq_\theta$ that are invariant under the composition operator $C_\vp$. More specifically, our aim is to study the following object:
\[D(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi \in \cls(\D): C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta\right\}.\]

**D(\clq_\theta)^***: For simplicity of notation, we write\[L(\clq_\theta)^* = L(\clq_\theta) \setminus \mathbb{C} \text{ and } D(\clq_\theta)^* = D(\clq_\theta) \setminus \mathbb{D}.\]

**L(\clq_\theta)**: This perspective suggests another object similar to $D(\clq_\theta)$, defined as follows:
\[
L(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi: \mathbb{C}_\infty \to \mathbb{C}_\infty
\text{ analytic},  \varphi \not \equiv \infty, \text{ and } C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta \right\}
\]
Observe that rational functions are precisely the functions holomorphic at $\infty$; hence, every element of $L(\clq_\theta)$ is necessarily a rational function (also see \cite[Section 1]{Jav}).

**L(\clq_\theta)^***: For simplicity of notation, we write \[ L(\clq_\theta)^* = L(\clq_\theta) \setminus \mathbb{C} \text{ and } D(\clq_\theta)^* = D(\clq_\theta) \setminus \mathbb{D}. \]

**\D**: \def\D{\mathbb{D}}

**\clq_\theta**: The \textit{model space} (or, \textit{finite-dimensional model space} to be more specific) associated with \theta is defined as \[ \clq_{\theta} = H^2 \ominus \theta H^2, \] where $H^2$ denotes the Hardy space on \D. It is known that \[ \text{dim} \clq_\theta = n. \]

**\mathbb{C}**: \mathbb{C} represents the space of all constant functions on \D.

**\theta(z)**: Let  $\theta(z) =z^m$, $m\geq 2$. 

---

\label{prop: z*m}
Let  $\theta(z) =z^m$, $m\geq 2$. Then
\begin{enumerate}
\item $L(\clq_\theta)= \{az+b: a, b \in \mathbb{C}, a\neq 0\}\cup \mathbb{C}$.
\item $D(\clq_\theta)=\{az+b: a, b \in \mathbb{C}, a\neq 0, |a|+|b|\leq 1 \}\cup \D$.
\item $L(\clq_\theta)^*= \{az+b: a, b \in \mathbb{C}, a\neq 0\}$ is a non-cyclic group.
\item $D(\clq_\theta)^*$ is not a group.
\end{enumerate}

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**C_\vp \clq_\theta**: The other key object in our study is the composition operator. Given an analytic self-map $\vp: \D \raro \D$ (in short, $\vp \in \cls(\D)$), the \textit{composition operator} $C_\vp$ is defined on $H^2$ by \[ C_\vp f = f \circ \vp \qquad (f \in H^2).\] It is a classical result that $C_\varphi$ is a bounded linear operator on $H^2$ for all $\varphi\in \mathcal{S}(\mathbb{D})$ \cite{Shapiro}. The goal of this paper is to determine finite Blaschke products $\theta$ and analytic self-maps $\vp \in \cls(\D)$ such that \[ C_\vp \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta, \] That is, the finite-dimensional model spaces $\clq_\theta$ that are invariant under the composition operator $C_\vp$. 

**\cls(\D)**: Given an analytic self-map $\vp: \D \raro \D$ (in short, $\vp \in \cls(\D)$), the \textit{composition operator} $C_\vp$ is defined on $H^2$ by
\[
C_\vp f = f \circ \vp \qquad (f \in H^2).
\]
It is a classical result that $C_\varphi$ is a bounded linear operator on $H^2$ for all $\varphi\in \mathcal{S}(\mathbb{D})$ \cite{Shapiro}. The goal of this paper is to determine finite Blaschke products $\theta$ and analytic self-maps $\vp \in \cls(\D)$ such that
\[
C_\vp \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta,
\]

**\vp**: \newcommand{\vp}{\varphi}

**b_{\lambda}^n**: We begin by considering the case where $\theta$ is a finite Blaschke product with a single zero of arbitrary multiplicity: \[ \theta = b_{\lambda}^n, \] for some $\lambda \in \mathbb{D} \setminus \{0\}$ and $n \in \mathbb{N}$. Let $\theta = b_{\lambda}^n$ for some $\lambda \in \mathbb{D} \setminus \{0\}$ and $n \in \mathbb{N}$. 

---

Let $\lambda \in \mathbb{D}$ be a nonzero scalar, $n \in \mathbb{N}$, and let $\vp \in \cls(\D)$ be a nonconstant function. Define
\[
\theta = z b_{\lambda}^n.
\]
Then $C_\vp \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta$ if and only if $\varphi \in \mathrm{Mob}(\mathbb{C}_\infty)$ and
\[
\vp\left(\frac{1}{\bar{\lambda}}\right) = \frac{1}{\bar{\lambda}}.
\]

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**D(\clq_\theta)**: The goal of this paper is to determine finite Blaschke products $\theta$ and analytic self-maps $\vp \in \cls(\D)$ such that
\[C_\vp \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta,\]That is, the finite-dimensional model spaces $\clq_\theta$ that are invariant under the composition operator $C_\vp$. More specifically, our aim is to study the following object:
\[D(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi \in \cls(\D): C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta\right\}.\]

**L(\clq_\theta)**: This perspective suggests another object similar to $D(\clq_\theta)$, defined as follows:
\[
L(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi: \mathbb{C}_\infty \to \mathbb{C}_\infty
\text{ analytic},  \varphi \not \equiv \infty, \text{ and } C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta \right\}
\]
Observe that rational functions are precisely the functions holomorphic at $\infty$; hence, every element of $L(\clq_\theta)$ is necessarily a rational function (also see \cite[Section 1]{Jav}).

**\cls(\D)**: Given an analytic self-map $\vp: \D \raro \D$ (in short, $\vp \in \cls(\D)$), the \textit{composition operator} $C_\vp$ is defined on $H^2$ by
\[
C_\vp f = f \circ \vp \qquad (f \in H^2).
\]
It is a classical result that $C_\varphi$ is a bounded linear operator on $H^2$ for all $\varphi\in \mathcal{S}(\mathbb{D})$ \cite{Shapiro}. The goal of this paper is to determine finite Blaschke products $\theta$ and analytic self-maps $\vp \in \cls(\D)$ such that
\[
C_\vp \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta,
\]

---

\label{cor: z b lambda}
Let $\lambda \in \mathbb{D} \setminus \{0\}$ and let $n \in \mathbb{N}$. Define
\[
\theta = z b_{\lambda}^n.
\]
Then
\[
L(\clq_\theta)= \left\{\vp \in  \mathrm{Mob}(\mathbb{C}_\infty): \vp\left(\frac{1}{\bar{\lambda}}\right) = \frac{1}{\bar{\lambda}} \right\} \cup \mathbb{C},
\]
and
\[
D(\clq_\theta)= \left\{\vp \in \cls(\D) \cap  \mathrm{Mob}(\mathbb{C}_\infty): \vp\left(\frac{1}{\bar{\lambda}}\right) = \frac{1}{\bar{\lambda}} \right\} \cup \mathbb{D}.
\]
Moreover, in this case, $D(\clq_\theta)^* \cap  \mathrm{Aut}(\mathbb{D})$ is uncountable, and $L(\clq_\theta)^*$ is an infinite group that is not cyclic.

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**D(\clq_\theta)**: The goal of this paper is to determine finite Blaschke products $\theta$ and analytic self-maps $\vp \in \cls(\D)$ such that
\[C_\vp \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta,\]That is, the finite-dimensional model spaces $\clq_\theta$ that are invariant under the composition operator $C_\vp$. More specifically, our aim is to study the following object:
\[D(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi \in \cls(\D): C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta\right\}.\]

**L(\clq_\theta)**: This perspective suggests another object similar to $D(\clq_\theta)$, defined as follows:
\[
L(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi: \mathbb{C}_\infty \to \mathbb{C}_\infty
\text{ analytic},  \varphi \not \equiv \infty, \text{ and } C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta \right\}
\]
Observe that rational functions are precisely the functions holomorphic at $\infty$; hence, every element of $L(\clq_\theta)$ is necessarily a rational function (also see \cite[Section 1]{Jav}).

**\D**: \def\D{\mathbb{D}}

**\lambda**: For each $\lambda$ in the open unit disc $\D = \{z \in \mathbb{C}: |z| < 1\}$, we define the corresponding \textit{Blaschke product} $b_\lambda$ as follows: \[ b_\lambda(z) = \frac{z - \lambda}{1 - \bar{\lambda} z}, \] for all $z \in \D$. Let $m\geq 2$, $n\geq 1$, and let $\lambda \in \D \setminus \{0\}$. Define \[ \theta = z^m b_\lambda^n. \]

**\mathbb{C}**: \mathbb{C} represents the space of all constant functions on \D.

**\theta**: Given \(\lambda_1, \ldots, \lambda_n \in \D\), we define the \textit{finite Blaschke product}\[\theta = \prod_{j=1}^{n} b_{\lambda_j}.\]

---

\label{thm m geq 2 lambda}
Let $m\geq 2$, $n\geq 1$, and let $\lambda \in \D \setminus \{0\}$. Define
\[
\theta = z^m b_\lambda^n.
\]
Then
\[
L(\clq_\theta)= \left\{(1-\bar{\lambda}a)z+a:a\neq \frac{1}{\bar{\lambda}} \right\} \cup \left(\mathbb{C} \setminus \left\{\frac{1}{\bar{\lambda}}\right\}\right),
\]
and
\[
D(\clq_\theta) =  \left\{z\right\} \cup \D.
\]

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**\clq_**: The "model space" (or, "finite-dimensional model space" to be more specific) associated with $
\theta$ is defined as
\[\clq_{\theta} = H^2 \ominus \theta H^2,\]
where $H^2$ denotes the Hardy space on $\D$. It is known that
\[
\text{dim} \clq_\theta = n.
\]

---

\label{cor: m 2 n 1 lambda}
Let $m\geq 2$ and $n\geq 1$ be natural numbers, and let $\lambda \in \D \setminus \{0\}$. Define
\[
\theta = z^m b_\lambda^n.
\]
Then $D(\clq_\theta)^*$ is a trivial group and $L(\clq_\theta)^*$ is an uncountable group.

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**$L(\clq_\theta)$**: This perspective suggests another object similar to $D(\clq_\theta)$, defined as follows:
\[
L(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi: \mathbb{C}_\infty \to \mathbb{C}_\infty
\text{ analytic},  \varphi \not \equiv \infty, \text{ and } C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta \right\}
\]
Observe that rational functions are precisely the functions holomorphic at $\infty$; hence, every element of $L(\clq_\theta)$ is necessarily a rational function (also see \cite[Section 1]{Jav}).

---

Consider a finite Blaschke product $\theta$ with $\theta(0)=0$. In this case, the constant functions belong to $L(\clq_\theta)$, but these are not invertible under composition. Hence, $L(\clq_\theta)$ cannot be a group under composition.

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
\label{propo}
Let $\theta$ be a finite Blaschke product satisfying $\theta(0)=0$, $\theta'(0)\neq 0$, and $\# (\clz(\theta)\setminus \{0\}) \geq 2$. Let $\varphi$ be a non-constant holomorphic self-map of $\mathbb{C}_\infty$. If $\varphi \in L(\clq_\theta)$, then $\varphi$ is a M\"obius  transformation of the form
\[
\varphi(z)=\dfrac{az+b}{cz+d},
\]
for some complex numbers $a, b, c, d$ satisfying $ad-bc\neq 0$.

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**D(\clq_\theta)**: The goal of this paper is to determine finite Blaschke products $\theta$ and analytic self-maps $\vp \in \cls(\D)$ such that
\[C_\vp \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta,\]That is, the finite-dimensional model spaces $\clq_\theta$ that are invariant under the composition operator $C_\vp$. More specifically, our aim is to study the following object:
\[D(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi \in \cls(\D): C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta\right\}.\]

**L(\clq_\theta)**: This perspective suggests another object similar to $D(\clq_\theta)$, defined as follows:
\[
L(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi: \mathbb{C}_\infty \to \mathbb{C}_\infty
\text{ analytic},  \varphi \not \equiv \infty, \text{ and } C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta \right\}
\]
Observe that rational functions are precisely the functions holomorphic at $\infty$; hence, every element of $L(\clq_\theta)$ is necessarily a rational function (also see \cite[Section 1]{Jav}).

**\clq_\theta**: The \textit{model space} (or, \textit{finite-dimensional model space} to be more specific) associated with \theta is defined as \[ \clq_{\theta} = H^2 \ominus \theta H^2, \] where $H^2$ denotes the Hardy space on \D. It is known that \[ \text{dim} \clq_\theta = n. \]

---

\label{lem2.7}
Let $\theta$ be a finite Blaschke product satisfying $\theta(0)=0$, $\theta'(0)\neq 0$, and let $\# (\clz(\theta)\setminus \{0\}) \geq 2$. Then $\varphi \in L(\clq_\theta)$  if and only if $\varphi$ is a M\"obius transformation and
\[
mult_\theta(\lambda)=mult_\theta(\tilde{\varphi}(\lambda)),
\]
for all $\lambda \in \clz(\theta)\setminus \{0\}$. More over, we have
\[
D(\clq_\theta)=L(\clq_\theta) \cap \mathcal{S}(\mathbb{D}).
\]

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**D(\clq_\theta)^***: For simplicity of notation, we write\[L(\clq_\theta)^* = L(\clq_\theta) \setminus \mathbb{C} \text{ and } D(\clq_\theta)^* = D(\clq_\theta) \setminus \mathbb{D}.\]

**\clq_\theta**: The \textit{model space} (or, \textit{finite-dimensional model space} to be more specific) associated with \theta is defined as \[ \clq_{\theta} = H^2 \ominus \theta H^2, \] where $H^2$ denotes the Hardy space on \D. It is known that \[ \text{dim} \clq_\theta = n. \]

**\clz**: \newcommand{\clz}{\mathcal{Z}}

**\theta**: Given \(\lambda_1, \ldots, \lambda_n \in \D\), we define the \textit{finite Blaschke product}\[\theta = \prod_{j=1}^{n} b_{\lambda_j}.\]

---

\label{cor: general group}
Let $\theta$ be a finite Blaschke product. Suppose $\theta(0)=0$ and $\#(\clz(\theta)\setminus \{0\}) \geq 2$. Then  $D(\clq_\theta)^*$  forms a group.

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**L(\clq_\theta)^***: For simplicity of notation, we write \[ L(\clq_\theta)^* = L(\clq_\theta) \setminus \mathbb{C} \text{ and } D(\clq_\theta)^* = D(\clq_\theta) \setminus \mathbb{D}. \]

---

Let $\theta$ be a finite Blaschke product. Suppose $\theta(0)=0$ and $\#(\clz(\theta)\setminus \{0\}) \geq 3$. Then $L(\clq_\theta)^*$ forms a group.

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**D(\clq_\theta)**: The goal of this paper is to determine finite Blaschke products $\theta$ and analytic self-maps $\vp \in \cls(\D)$ such that
\[C_\vp \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta,\]That is, the finite-dimensional model spaces $\clq_\theta$ that are invariant under the composition operator $C_\vp$. More specifically, our aim is to study the following object:
\[D(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi \in \cls(\D): C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta\right\}.\]

**\theta**: Given \(\lambda_1, \ldots, \lambda_n \in \D\), we define the \textit{finite Blaschke product}\[\theta = \prod_{j=1}^{n} b_{\lambda_j}.\]

**a=e^{\frac{2\pi i}{n}}**: Set \[ a=e^{\frac{2\pi i}{n}}. \]

---

Let $n\geq 2$ be a natural number, and let $\{\lambda_1, \ldots, \lambda_s\} \subseteq \mathbb{D}\setminus \{0\}$. Set
\[
\theta = \prod_{j=1}^s \left(\prod_{k=1}^nb_{{a^k\lambda_j}}\right)^{m_j},
\]
where
\[
a=e^{\frac{2\pi i}{n}}.
\]
Assume that $\{|\lambda_1|, \ldots, |\lambda_s|\}$ is a set of distinct real numbers. Then
\[
D(\clq_\theta)=\langle az \rangle.
\]

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**$D$**: \def\D{\mathbb{D}}

---

\label{theta2}
Let $\theta$ be a finite Blaschke product that does not vanish at the origin, and let $\vp \in \cls(\D)$. Then
\[
C_{\varphi}(\clq_\theta) \subseteq \clq_\theta,
\]
if and only if
\[
C_{\varphi}(\clq_\theta) = \clq_\theta.
\]

title: Finite-dimensional model spaces invariant under composition operators
abstract: Finite-dimensional model spaces are quotient spaces of the Hardy space on the open unit disc, determined by finite Blaschke products. Composition operators, on the other hand, act by composing Hardy space functions with analytic self-maps of the open unit disc. Both are classical and well-studied objects in the theory of analytic function spaces. In this paper, we present a complete characterization of finite-dimensional model spaces that are invariant under composition operators. Finite cyclic groups and the prime factorizations of natural numbers play a crucial role in understanding the structure of such invariant subspaces and the associated analytic self-maps.
content:
**D(\clq_\theta)**: The goal of this paper is to determine finite Blaschke products $\theta$ and analytic self-maps $\vp \in \cls(\D)$ such that
\[C_\vp \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta,\]That is, the finite-dimensional model spaces $\clq_\theta$ that are invariant under the composition operator $C_\vp$. More specifically, our aim is to study the following object:
\[D(\clq_\theta) = \left\{\varphi \in \cls(\D): C_\varphi \clq_\theta \subseteq \clq_\theta\right\}.\]

**\clq_\theta**: The \textit{model space} (or, \textit{finite-dimensional model space} to be more specific) associated with \theta is defined as \[ \clq_{\theta} = H^2 \ominus \theta H^2, \] where $H^2$ denotes the Hardy space on \D. It is known that \[ \text{dim} \clq_\theta = n. \]

---

If $\theta=z$, then $\clq_\theta=\mathbb{C}$ is trivially invariant under every composition operator. Next, consider an analytic self-map $\varphi$ of $\mathbb{D}$ that is not a M\"obius map (for instance, $\varphi=z^2$). Since $\varphi$ is neither a rotation nor a  M\"obius map, it follows from the results of this paper that $\varphi\notin D(\clq_\theta)$ for all $\theta$ other than $z$. That is, $\clq_\theta$ is not invariant under $C_\varphi$ for any $\theta$ other than $z$. Hence, there exist many composition operators for which no non-trivial model space is invariant. That is, except for $\mathbb{C}$, all other model spaces fail to be invariant under any composition operator induced by a non-M\"obius maps.
